intro: Lithocarpus sabulicola, commonly known as the sandhill stone oak, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, chestnuts, and beeches. It is a deciduous tree native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and produces small, hard nuts enclosed in a cupule. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. The botanical features of Lithocarpus sabulicola make it an important component of the forest ecosystems in its native habitat.
